abstract: Indian court drops charges against activist Irom Sharmila, who had been on nearly 15-year hunger strike protesting a law governing security forces in remote areas; also orders her release from hospital, where she had been kept in custody and force-fed since 2000.
lead_paragraph: A court on Thursday ordered the release of an activist who has been on a hunger strike for nearly 15 years to protest a law that gives Indian security forces special powers to fight insurgents.
snippet: A court on Thursday ordered the release of an activist who has been on a hunger strike for nearly 15 years to protest a law that gives Indian security forces special powers to fight insurgents.

headline.main: India: Court Orders Release of Activist
headline.print_headline: India: Court Orders Release of Activist
